definition: Adapting teaching methods, content, and assessment to meet diverse learner needs and abilities

positive_examples: Students chose from three different reading levels on the same topic.
The teacher provided scaffolded versions of the assignment for different skill levels.
Advanced learners received extension activities while others got additional support.
Multiple pathways to the same learning goal accommodate different learning styles.
negative_examples: Everyone completed the same worksheet at the same pace.
All students took the identical test regardless of preparation.
The lecture proceeded at a fixed rate for the whole class.

simplex_mapping.mapping_rationale: Respects individual learner needs and paths
